definition: Valid result with documented action (referral, outreach, Rx, urgent/routine follow-up).
recommended_intervention: Reinforce timely follow-up workflows; highlight best-practice examples in clinic huddles.

definition: Normal result, no action taken, and order likely outside guideline context.
recommended_intervention: Provider education on evidence-based ordering; add EMR nudges for low-value tests and frequency limits.

definition: Borderline cases (e.g., abnormal result without documented action; action despite normal result).
recommended_intervention: Targeted chart audits; case reviews; refine documentation and routing of results to ensure follow-up.
Patient outreach (calls/texts); scheduling reminders; EMR flags for pending/expired orders.
